DataElement.preferredName: Autologous Stem Cell Transplantation Relapse Myeloma Intent Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the code yes/no indicator whether there was a transference of stem cells within the same individual as anticipated outcome from return of a bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Autologous Stem Cell Transplantation Relapse Myeloma Intent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to transference of stem cells within the same individual as anticipated outcome from return of a bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The transference of stem cells within the same individual.

Concepts.definition: Stem cell transfer or transplantation in which the patient is their own donor.

Property.preferredDefinition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.:A bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.  Clinical variants include non-secretory myeloma, smoldering myeloma, indolent myeloma, and plasma cell leukemia. (WHO, 2001) -- 2003:Intent; an anticipated outcome that is intended or that guides your planned actions.

Concepts.definition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

A bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.  Clinical variants include non-secretory myeloma, smoldering myeloma, indolent myeloma, and plasma cell leukemia. (WHO, 2001)
An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
